result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R Zold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
62 days credit, if revoked.
Consecutive to: present sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to Huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason R Zold in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 1, 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- Total sentence: 3 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) Stayed for 2 years Probation - 62 days credit if revoked. Consecutive to present sentence defendant is serving. 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 -  2 months jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.

Defendant Jason R Zold in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Criminal Complaint was previously filed by the State to amend this matter to a Felony charge. Court addresses the Amended Criminal Complaint. State is requesting that the court allow them to file this amended complaint and presents further statements. State requests a preliminary hearing be set. Defense responds and objects to the Amended Criminal Complaint and requests a preliminary hearing within 10 days if Court accepts this complaint. Defendant to remain at the Waukesha County Jail. Court will permit the filing of the amended criminal complaint and will set a preliminary hearing within 10 days. Drug treatment court addressed by Defense.
